goal.ch: 星際空間的物質成分、分布，以及物理與化學性質
goal.en: The constituents, distribution, and physical plus chemical properties of the matter in space, and their interaction with EM waves

outline.ch: “The course consists of two main parts: (1) the morphological and physical characteristics of various material components found in the interstellar space, from extremely cold molecular clouds, to diffuse atomic hydrogen nebulae, to hot ionized gases around luminous stars; (2) our current understanding of star-forming processes, as well as interactions between stars and their environments, will be reviewed.  We will discuss what has been observed, and the theories to interpret these results.“
outline.en: “The course consists of two main parts: (1) the morphological and physical characteristics of various material components found in the interstellar space, from extremely cold molecular clouds, to diffuse atomic hydrogen nebulae, to hot ionized gases around luminous stars; (2) our current understanding of star-forming processes, as well as interactions between stars and their environments, will be reviewed.  We will discuss what has been observed, and the theories to interpret these results.“

textbook.ch: “Physics of the Interstellar and Intergalactic Medium, by Bruce T. Draine (2011, Princeton)“
textbook.en: “Physics of the Interstellar and Intergalactic Medium, by Bruce T. Draine (2011, Princeton)“

gradMethod.ch: Grading: Classroom/Homework/Report:40％; midterm exam: 30％; final exam: 30％
gradMethod.en: Grading: Classroom/Homework/Report: 40％; midterm exam: 30％; final exam: 30％
